8.Name: Traction
8.Desc: Pulls targets within range towards a specific position

14.Name: Havoc DMG Amplification
14.Desc: Provides Havoc DMG Amplification for a specific Resonator in the team

20.Name: Basic Attack DMG Amplification
20.Desc: Provides Basic Attack DMG Amplification for a specific Resonator in the team

Name: Roccia
Desc:
Assistant, prop master, and improv comedian, Roccia is always there to make sure the <te href=850108>Troupe of Fools</te> is at the ready.

The Magic Box she carries appears to hold the world, or perhaps she had recreated a world inside the box.

CharaInfo.Info:
Assistant, prop master, and improv comedian, Roccia is always there to make sure the <te href=850108>Troupe of Fools</te> is at the ready.

The Magic Box she carries appears to hold the world, or perhaps she had recreated a world inside the box.
CharaInfo.TalentDoc:
[Troupe Medic Benir's Notes - R103]
 
After watching Roccia on a few occasions and studying her behaviors, it seems like our first mate has a way of communicating with that strange creature, <te href=850122>Pero</te>. With Pero acting as a translator, Roccia can even talk to other <te href=850082>Echoes</te>. What's interesting is that her ability seems to be growing—at first, she needed to speak with the Echoes, but now it looks like she can communicate through frequencies.

This only started after she joined the troupe and met Pero, so I'm guessing it's some sort of resonance between them, something she picked up along the way. We'd probably call her a Non-congenital Resonator.

P.S. All this is just my best guess, though. With the tools I have, I can't pin down exactly what type she might be. There's a small chance Roccia isn't actually a Resonator, but just so happens to be able to sync up with certain frequencies. Wouldn't that still count as being a Resonator? I'll have to think on it.
CharaInfo.TalentCertification:
[Troupe Medic Benir's Notes - R103]
 
During the examination, Roccia chose white clams, seaweed, pink salt, and filtered water to make a pot of clam soup. It turned out nice and clear, with the shells intact. Right when it was done, the clams and seaweed looked a bit like a tiny island—or maybe even a little box.
 
From the way the soup came together, it's clear Roccia's senses are sharp, her mind is calm, and that she has a strong bond with the troupe. No sign of <te href=850073>Overclocking</te> here.

P.S. Roccia had the brilliant idea of replacing the teacup assessment with a soup assessment. After all, soup is more filling, and after the examination, there's enough for everyone to have a meal. It doesn't taste too bad, either.

Stories.Title: Golden Harpoon
Stories.Content:
Battier, the <te href=850108>Fool's Troupe</te>'s best fisherman, ran into trouble one day on what was supposed to be an ordinary fishing trip. With only his trusted harpoon, he fought against an aquatic <te href=850081>Tacet Discord</te> so ferocious that it soon dragged him beneath the waves. Luckily, Roccia sensed something was off when Battier didn't return as expected and quickly rallied troupe members to form a small rescue team. They searched the nearby waters and finally pulled a drenched, beleaguered Battier ashore. However, his well-worn harpoon hadn't fared as well—it was wedged tight in the Tacet Discord's side, and both were swallowed by a whirlpool in the sea.

Without his harpoon, Battier felt like he'd lost part of his spirit. He'd spend hours baiting traps and coming up empty, as if the fish sensed his missing piece, too. Some days, he'd just lie in the black sand of the Strand, staring at the dim sky. Even the clouds seemed to taunt him, shaping themselves into fish that drifted further and further away.
 
"Aaaaah—!" he shouted at the sky in helpless frustration.
 
As if to ease his mind, the clouds began to part, layer by layer, and beams of light spilled down, turning the sky into a shimmering sea. Right in the center, his lost harpoon appeared, descending like a divine gift from the heavens, gleaming in golden sunlight. It landed straight into his hand as if it had never left. In the meantime, fish swarmed to him once more, dancing through the air and across the water.
 
Heartened by this wonder, Battier hauled in a full net to bring back to the troupe. Roccia and <te href=850122>Pero</te> used the catch to whip up a feast—roasted squid, creamy clam chowder, peppered fish steaks, and so on. The air was filled with the rich aroma of seafood as everyone gathered by the fire, laughing and eating together. Someone even wielded a fish skewer as a sword, putting on a little show that had people in stitches. Looking at the jolly crowd, Battier felt a warm feeling inside—it's the simple joy of being needed and the thrill of fishing for those who truly appreciated him.
 
While the others were enjoying the feast, Roccia exchanged a quick smile with Pero before hiding the Cloudcaster they'd used earlier in a haystack. As a prop master, she knew how much meaning certain objects held for people. No matter how difficult, she'd always find a way to retrieve what was lost—whether from the sea or the sky. After giving them a good polish, she'd plan a heartwarming, dramatic reunion, just as she'd done with Battier's golden harpoon.
 
From that day on, the troupe had a new show: Battier and the Golden Harpoon. The crew enjoyed re-enacting this enchanting story with grilled fish in hand and hearts full of laughter.

Stories.Title: Safe Voyage
Stories.Content:
To become the troupe's first mate, one must prove they can face down any storm the sea can throw at them. That's why every first mate must pass a trial—a perilous voyage led by the troupe's best helmsperson. For Roccia, her helmsperson was none other than Tina.

Even with young Roccia onboard, Tina held firm, steering the ship straight into the heart of a brewing storm with steady hands, unflinching as she faced the dark, roiling waves.

Roccia didn't seem fazed at first. She calmly pulled out one of <te href=850122>Pero</te>'s scripts, reading as if she were back under the troupe's tent instead of on a ship pitching wildly in the storm. She dabbed seawater from her face, reading plays prepared by Pero as though it were all a practiced routine. Years of crafting props and performing on stage had made her adaptable, and her time with Pero had taught her to understand and respond to the subtle frequencies of the Echo ship.
 
But as they reached the depths of the storm, faint, glowing eyes began to surface in the dark waters, and ominous whispers carried on the wind. Roccia's steady demeanor seemed to falter—her hand wavered as she tucked the script away and gripped the edge of the cabin. Eventually, even the hardened Tina noticed Roccia's trembling. At a loss on how to comfort her, Tina instead raised her voice in song, her voice strong and steady, resonating with the <te href=850082>Echo</te> ship. All she could do in this situation was to hold the ship steady through the rough waters, which required absolute focus.
 
Then, a softer voice joined her. Tina looked back to see Roccia huddled near the cabin, singing along with a light quaver in her voice. Though fear glinted in her eyes, Roccia hadn't forgotten her duty. She took out her telescope, scanning the dark horizon for their course. Tina's voice rose stronger, blending with Roccia's softer notes, overpowering the ominous whispers around them. Catching the right current, the ship surged forward, breaking through the storm into the first light of dawn.

Back on shore, Roccia's face was as calm and collected as ever. From that day on, First Mate Roccia guided every voyage with a steady hand, always bringing people safely home.

"Roccia?" Tina, known for her blunt honesty, was asked later. She grinned, a glint of pride in her eyes. "She's tough and dependable—a good girl who deserves love and care. As for her pitch… well, let's just say it may not be perfect, but it's got heart."

Stories.Title: Old Ticket
Stories.Content:
Besides the twinkling star, little Luca's most cherished item is an old ticket.
 
Luca remembers the day Roccia handed it to her after she'd been rescued from the Strand. Roccia was calm and steady, even though she couldn't have been much older than Luca herself. She could handle anything—helping lost pilgrims who drifted ashore, cooking meals for the troupe, recording funny moments, collecting seashells and Luceanites, even refilling the confetti pistol. And of course, cheering up homesick little newcomers like Luca was all part of her role.
 
One day, Luca looked up at Roccia with a sniffle, holding the ticket tightly in her little hand. "I miss my Mama, Roccia… I want to go home and see her. But I only have a one-way ticket, and I lost it…"

The ticket in his hand read, "One-Way Ticket to Wonderland," written in beautiful handwriting with tiny flowers around the edges.

Roccia knew right away what this was about. The Order, always busy banishing anyone who challenged them, would never be so kind as to make such a heartwarming ticket. She was sure Luca's mother had made it herself, hoping to give her a bit of comfort. Roccia wanted to reveal the truth to her. "The Order didn't make these tickets, Luca. From the handwriting, it looks like a kind lady made it… someone who loves you." "They were made by your mother, Luca. They can't really bring you home, so it doesn't matter if they're lost."

But she knew saying that might only make Luca cry more.

Roccia thought for a moment, then left and returned with a new ticket—a "Return Ticket," decorated with painted flowers, seashells, and a hand-drawn stamp that read, "Arrived at Wonderland."

Luca's face lit up as she took it, clutching it tightly with a huge smile.

As the troupe's prop master, Roccia could easily make something like that, but there was more to it than just crafting. She remembered when <te href=850122>Pero</te> had done the same for her when she first arrived on the island. Sometimes, a little piece of paper was all it took to hold a whole lot of hope.

Stories.Title: Peculiar Box
Stories.Content:
Little Roccia lay weak on the Strand, with the wreckage of her pilgrim ship battered to pieces by the waves behind her. Her fading eyes caught glimpses of <te href=850081>Tacet Discords</te> scattered across the water. So this would be the end of her "pilgrimage"... She closed her eyes, bracing herself for what she thought would be "divine judgment."
 
However, death didn't come as she expected. All she could hear was wind and faint cries in the air. When she opened her eyes, she found herself face-to-face with a peculiar box and a long arm reaching out to her—a hand offering her a second chance at life.
 
At first, Roccia felt lost after joining the troupe, for the little world she once knew had shattered. She soon realized she had been banished simply for singing songs from forbidden plays. The <te href=850097>Ragunna</te> she remembered—alive with plays, flowers, and freedom—had faded, leaving only the Order's lies and the hollow shell of her memories. The pilgrimage she once believed in was a ruse, wrapped in false promises, with a so-called "return ticket" meant only to fool children like her. Overnight, everything she held dear crumbled. Roccia began to question her love for theater—was it even worth anything anymore? But stranded on a desolate island, she found nothing else to rebuild her world.
 
"Pero! Pero!" The odd box handed her a small, hand-drawn ticket with "Return Trip" written on it, decorated with painted seashells.
 
"Pero! Pero!" It passed her a yellowed play script, filled with tales of Ragunna and lyrics of freedom.
 
"Pero! Pero!" Out came a beautifully crafted mask, painted with intricate patterns and adorned with pearls and shells.
 
"Pero! Pero!" The box reached out to her once more, inviting her to join the troupe's next performance. Tina's bright voice rang out, Bardolino flew in the air with balloons and tossed petals, Brant swung down on a rope holding a massive welcome banner, and <te href=850122>Pero</te> fired the confetti pistol, inviting her to the stage. This lively, chaotic welcome was Roccia's first taste of a different kind of play—a play filled with nothing but pure joy.

From that moment on, Roccia began to rebuild her world through the plays held within Pero's box. She saw that Ragunna's grand stage had been a place of strict control, where only songs that conformed to the Order's tenets were permitted. But here, among her fellow "Fools," she could finally express everything—joy, anger, and sorrow—freely. Together, they were all building a new home.

Now, Roccia works confidently between the troupe's base and the Strand, calmly coordinating the rescue of new pilgrims and keeping this safe harbor running. Each task, no matter how small, is a piece of the home she's building—a place where she can finally belong, busy and content.

Stories.Title: New Stage
Stories.Content:
People came and went in the <te href=850108>Troupe of Fools</te>, each one inspiring Roccia's lively performances. Shows like "Battier and the Golden Harpoon," "Tina the Soprano Navigator," "Brant the Maverick Captain," and "<te href=850122>Pero</te> the Peculiar Box" became legends of their own. By now, she and the crew had put on over two hundred performances, lighting up every corner of Penitent's End.

The troupe didn't have much, so as the prop master, Roccia became a master of turning everyday items into theater magic. Battier's golden harpoon, for instance, had played the part of a Primus's scepter, a wandering knight's sword, and even the La Guardia's dagger. The <te href=850082>Echo</te> ship had starred as everything from a lifeboat to a windmill giant's boot and even the eye of a sea monster.

For years, Roccia and Pero explored every inch of the Troupe's home base, every stretch of the island shore. They collected countless Luceanites from the Strand and watched thousands of sunrises. Like the others, they had been confined to this place for too long. The troupe was a warm haven for every member, but inevitably, some still dreamed of distant horizons while others longed for the homes they had left behind.

When the long-awaited music of the <te href=850102>Carnevale</te> drifted across the sea from <te href=850097>Ragunna</te>, along with petals celebrating the crowned <te href=850103>Laureate</te>, the Troupe of Fools felt the undeniable pull of a homeward wind.

Childhood memories were hazy for Roccia, but as she followed Brant and the crew into Ragunna's streets, the familiar smell of Trattoria Margherita's fresh-baked pizza and the songs spilling from the Odyssey Opera House stirred something deep within her, just like it did everyone else.

Under a golden sun in a clear sky, the city streets stretched out like a stage waiting for her. A soft breeze seemed to nudge open the box she had always hidden herself in, inviting her to step into a broader world. With open arms and a steady heart, Roccia took her first steps into Ragunna, welcoming a better tomorrow.

Now, as the Troupe of Fools' reliable first mate, Roccia stands ready to fill Ragunna's streets with laughter and joy once more.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: I
Voices.Content: I'm always on the go, collecting treasures, helping my friends, making costumes, and repairing stage props... It's a busy routine, but seeing everyone smiling makes it all worth it.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: II
Voices.Content: <te href=850122>Pero</te>'s box is more than just a treasure trove. It's my private lounge as well. It's bigger than you might think, and I've stashed all my nifty gadgets inside. Would you like a tour? Knock, knock—open up, Pero.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: III
Voices.Content: Apparently, the mix of my over-the-top gestures and stoic face is hilarious to people. See? Just like that. Oh, did I actually get a chuckle out of you? Guess I'll keep this style going, then.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: IV
Voices.Content: Our troupe never lets anyone feel left out. We accept everyone, chasing away their worries and inviting them to be a part of the performance. If you ever feel down or sad, come see us. I'd really like to see you smile.

Voices.Title: Thoughts: V
Voices.Content: People say family is about helping and comforting each other. I feel safe and warm around you... So, maybe you count as family after all?

Voices.Title: Roccia's Hobby
Voices.Content: I like turning the things I collect into stage props. They might not look fancy at first, but each one has its own special story. On stage, the ordinary becomes extraordinary, and I think that's worth something.

Voices.Title: Roccia's Trouble
Voices.Content: Cleaning up the ship is always a headache. There's algae, sewage spills, and torn canvas everywhere... And of course, there's always that person who conveniently disappears when it's time to pitch in. Pft, not like a good living and performance space is important or anything. You agree, right?

Voices.Title: Favorite Food
Voices.Content: Spaghetti Bolognese is great on its own, but it's even better when shared. Maybe... it's the company that makes it taste better?

Voices.Title: Disliked Food
Voices.Content: Every time I see the mess those drunkards leave behind... Ugh, I just want to dump all the booze into the ocean.

Voices.Title: Ideals
Voices.Content: One day, the streets of <te href=850097>Ragunna</te> will be alive with the spirit of freedom. Until then, I want it to grow within our troupe. We'll make the sad smile, help the hopeless dream again, give courage to the fearful, and remind everyone of who we really are.

Voices.Title: Chat: I
Voices.Content: <te href=850122>Pero</te> is my best friend. She's amazing. She can detect special frequencies on objects, carry all my stuff, and even absorb good and bad feelings and inspirations. But don't worry, she won't gobble up anything harmful, dangerous, or anything that belongs to someone.

Voices.Title: Chat: II
Voices.Content: Luceanite pebbles, if not collected in time, will lose their glow and turn to dust. I used to be one of those lost pebbles, until the <te href=850108>Troupe of Fools</te> came along and saved me. Now, I can help other lost souls with my own little light.

Voices.Title: About Brant
Voices.Content: Brant is the greatest captain in all of Solaris. At least, that's what he insists I say. But it's true, having him around really does bring out the best in us. His passion is infectious, and his belief in freedom is like the mast that keeps us all steady.

Voices.Title: About Carlotta
Voices.Content: Leading a large family is like steering a massive ship. It requires immense effort to keep it on course. I have firsthand experience in managing a vessel, and I admire her energy and bravery in navigating this journey.

Voices.Title: About Zani
Voices.Content: Zani is the definition of a proper adult. Working with her is so easy, so comfortable, and I never have to worry about anything going wrong...

Voices.Title: About Phoebe
Voices.Content: She's from the <te href=850099>Order of the Deep</te>. I don't know her very well, but… she was the first <te href=850100>Acolyte</te> to touch the box without getting bitten by <te href=850122>Pero</te>.

Voices.Title: Birthday Wishes
Voices.Content: There's a new show in the works, a little something we've been rehearsing. Come check it out if you have the time. Spoiler alert... It's kind of important you're there for the show to work. Why? Because you're the main character! Happy birthday!

Voices.Title: Idle: I
Voices.Content:
The show begins. 
"Pero!"

Voices.Title: Idle: II
Voices.Content: (Effort sound)

Voices.Title: Idle: III
Voices.Content: (Effort sound)

Voices.Title: Self-Introduction
Voices.Content: Hello, name's Roccia. Besides being the <te href=850108>Troupe of Fools</te>' first mate, I am also a stage mechanic and an improv performer. If you ever stumble upon something interesting, I'm a really good listener. <te href=850122>Pero</te> stores all that inspiration, and I'll spin it into a new improv act.

Voices.Title: Greeting
Voices.Content: All the world's a stage, and we are mere players.

Voices.Title: Join Team: I
Voices.Content: <te href=850122>Pero</te>'s tummy is rumbling. Inspiration, don't be shy!

Voices.Title: Join Team: II
Voices.Content: Tornado makers, dimension-warping lamps... I've got all kinds of props if you're interested.

Voices.Title: Join Team: III
Voices.Content: Time for a little laugh.

Voices.Title: Ascension: I
Voices.Content: <te href=850122>Pero</te> said she's feeling good. Get ready for her happy dance!

Voices.Title: Ascension: II
Voices.Content: <te href=850122>Pero</te> said she's feeling like she can take out a hundred foes with one punch!

Voices.Title: Ascension: III
Voices.Content: <te href=850122>Pero</te> said she likes you even more now. Seems her strength and confidence are growing fast.

Voices.Title: Ascension: IV
Voices.Content: <te href=850122>Pero</te> said she finally has the power to protect everyone she cares about.

Voices.Title: Ascension: V
Voices.Content: <te href=850122>Pero</te> said she's grateful for how far she's come, thanks to you... Ahem. Sorry, scratch that. Pero never actually said any of that. It's all me, Roccia. Those are the things I've been wanting to tell you.

Voices.Title: Basic Attack
Voices.Content: PERO: Pero!

Voices.Title: Heavy Attack
Voices.Content: Surprise!

Voices.Title: Aerial Attack: I
Voices.Content: Mamma mia!

Voices.Title: Aerial Attack: II
Voices.Content: Avanti!

Voices.Title: Aerial Attack: III
Voices.Content: Figurati!

Voices.Title: Resonance Skill: I
Voices.Content:
Tempest show.
PERO: PEROOO!

Voices.Title: Resonance Skill: II
Voices.Content:
Tornado maker.
PERO: Whoosh—Whoosh—

Voices.Title: Resonance Skill: III
Voices.Content:
Up we go, <te href=850122>Pero</te>.
PERO: Haah!

Voices.Title: Resonance Liberation: I
Voices.Content:
All the world's a stage.
PERO: Pero! Hmph!

Voices.Title: Resonance Liberation: II
Voices.Content:
Time for some crowd work.
PERO: Pero! Rawrrr!

Voices.Title: Resonance Liberation: III
Voices.Content:
Improv performance.
PERO: Pero! Pero!

Voices.Title: Intro Skill
Voices.Content: Aerial stunt.

Voices.Title: Hit: I
Voices.Content: Can't lose the rhythm.

Voices.Title: Hit: II
Voices.Content: Every story needs drama.

Voices.Title: Injured: I
Voices.Content: Unexpected plot twist.

Voices.Title: Injured: II
Voices.Content: A turn of events.

Voices.Title: Injured: III
Voices.Content: Time for a comeback.

Voices.Title: Fallen: I
Voices.Content: Better stay behind the scenes…

Voices.Title: Fallen: II
Voices.Content: The curtain's drawn.

Voices.Title: Fallen: III
Voices.Content: The spark fades...

Voices.Title: Echo Summon
Voices.Content: A supporting actor.

Voices.Title: Echo Transform
Voices.Content: I'll warm up the crowd.

Voices.Title: Enemies Near
Voices.Content: We'll improvise.

Voices.Title: Sensor
Voices.Content: Looks like we've found something.

Voices.Title: Supply Chest: I
Voices.Content: This should come in handy.

Voices.Title: Supply Chest: II
Voices.Content: No, <te href=850122>Pero</te>. That's not for you.

Voices.Title: Supply Chest: III
Voices.Content: Shiny stuff.

Goods.Title: Portable Confetti Pistol
Goods.Content: A confetti pistol crafted from recycled materials by Roccia. Despite her reserved nature, she never forgets to add a burst of confetti for those cheerful, dramatic moments in life—a little surprise, a quick-witted remark from a troupe member, and so on, each deserving its own small celebration.

Goods.Title: Pero's Peculiar Box
Goods.Content: Ever since <te href=850122>Pero</te> saved Roccia, they've been close friends with a shared love for theater. Years of reading plays stored in Pero's box have shaped Roccia's taste for drama, just like how their time spent crafting props and performing together has deepened their bond. And for Pero, after a century of life, Roccia's presence has brought warmth to her world. They've given each other a second life, both becoming better versions of themselves.

Goods.Title: Luceanite Prop Set
Goods.Content: A unique prop set crafted by Roccia, made from Luceanites that hold the emotions and memories of those long departed. When brought onto the stage, these lingering feelings glimmer within each line and monologue, casting a light that, as Roccia believes, allows their original keepers to shine once more.

SpecialCook.Name: Multi-Scoop Ice Cream
SpecialCook.Desc: Reduces Flight STA consumption for all Resonators in the team by 18% for 30m. Only effective on your own Resonators in Co-op Mode.

Skill.Name: Acrobatic Trick
Skill.Desc: Roccia projects her creativity into reality, pulling in nearby targets and dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>. She then launches into mid-air and activates the <color=Highlight><te href=850016>Beyond Imagination</te></color> state.
Skill.SimpleDesc: Pull in nearby targets, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>, and send Roccia into mid-air, activating <color=Highlight>Beyond Imagination</color>.

Skill.Desc: Roccia's improvised comedy begins! Deal <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color> to the target, considered Heavy Attack DMG. For every {1} of Roccia's Crit. Rate over {0}, this skill increases the ATK of all Resonators in the team by <SapTag=2>{2}</SapTag> {Cus:Sap,S=point P=points SapTag=2} for {3}s, up to {4} points.

- The Magic Box lasts for {0}s or until the Resonator is switched out.

Skill.Name: Pero, Help
Skill.Desc: Attack the target, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>. Use <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> right after casting this skill to cast <color=Highlight>Basic Attack Stage 4</color>.
Skill.SimpleDesc: Attack the target, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>. Use <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> right after casting this skill to cast <color=Highlight>Basic Attack Stage 4</color>.

Skill.Name: A Prop Master Prepares
Skill.Desc:
<size=40><color=Title>Beyond Imagination</color></size>
- When Roccia is in <color=Highlight>Beyond Imagination</color> with at least {0} Imagination, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} the <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> button to consume {0} Imagination to cast Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Real Fantasy</color>.
- Roccia exits this state when she is not airborne or when switched off the field.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Basic Attack - Real Fantasy</color></size>
- Perform up to 3 consecutive attacks, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>, considered Heavy Attack DMG. When Roccia lands after Stage 1 and Stage 2 attacks with over {0} Imagination, she will launch into mid-air and activate <color=Highlight>Beyond Imagination</color>.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Imagination</color></size>
Roccia can hold up to {1} Imagination.
- Dealing DMG with Normal Attacks restores Imagination.
- Hold <color=Highlight>Normal Attack</color> to charge the next attack while restoring Imagination.
- Casting Resonance Skill <color=Highlight>Acrobatic Trick</color> restores {2} Imagination.
- Casting Intro Skill <color=Highlight>Pero, Help</color> restores {3} Imagination.
Skill.SimpleDesc:
<size=40><color=Title>Beyond Imagination</color></size>
- When Roccia is in <color=Highlight>Beyond Imagination</color> with at least {0} Imagination, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} the <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> button to consume {0} Imagination to cast Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Real Fantasy</color>.
- Roccia exits this state when she is not airborne or when switched off the field.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Basic Attack - Real Fantasy</color></size>
- Perform up to 3 consecutive attacks, dealing <color=Dark>Havoc DMG</color>. When Roccia lands after Stage 1 and Stage 2 attacks, she will launch into mid-air and activate <color=Highlight>Beyond Imagination</color>.
<size=10> </size>
<size=40><color=Title>Imagination</color></size>
Roccia can hold up to {1} Imagination.
- Obtain Imagination through Normal Attacks, Resonance Skill <color=Highlight>Acrobatic Trick</color>, and Intro Skill <color=Highlight>Pero, Help</color>.

Skill.Name: Applause, Please!
Skill.Desc: The incoming Resonator has their Havoc DMG Amplified by {0} and Basic Attack DMG Amplified by {1} for {2}s or until the Resonator is switched out.
Skill.SimpleDesc: The incoming Resonator has their Havoc DMG Amplified by {0} and Basic Attack DMG Amplified by {1}. Switching out the Resonator ends the effect.

Skill.Name: Tune Break: Gauntlets
Skill.Desc: When the target's <color=Highlight>Off-Tune Level</color> is full, the Resonator may cast <color=Highlight><te href=100001>Tune Break</te></color> on the target.
Skill.SimpleDesc: When the target's <color=Highlight>Off-Tune Level</color> is full, the Resonator may cast <color=Highlight><te href=100001>Tune Break</te></color> on the target.

1.Name: When Shadows Engulf the Hull
1.Desc:
Casting Resonance Skill <color=Highlight>Acrobatic Trick</color> grants {0} additional <te href=850015>Imagination</te> and {1} Concerto Energy.
Immune to interruptions when casting Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Real Fantasy</color>

2.Name: When the Luceanite Gleams
2.Desc: Casting Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Real Fantasy</color> grants all Resonators in the team {0} Havoc DMG Bonus for {2}s, stacking up to <SapTag=1>{1}</SapTag> {Cus:Sap,S=time P=times SapTag=1}. Upon reaching the max stacks, it grants all Resonators in the team {3} additional Havoc DMG Bonus for {4}s.

3.Name: When the Heart Sees and Hands Feel
3.Desc: Casting Intro Skill <color=Highlight>Pero, Help</color> increases Roccia's Crit. Rate by {0} and Crit. DMG by {1} for {2}s.

4.Name: When Wonders Gather in the Box
4.Desc: Casting Resonance Skill <color=Highlight>Acrobatic Trick</color> increases Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Real Fantasy</color>'s DMG Multiplier by {0} for {1}s.

5.Name: When Dreams Are Reborn on Stage
5.Desc: Increase Resonance Liberation <color=Highlight>Commedia Improvviso!</color>'s DMG Multiplier by {0} and <color=Highlight>Heavy Attack</color>'s DMG Multiplier by {1}.

6.Name: When the Golden Wings Fly
6.Desc:
Casting Resonance Liberation <color=Highlight>Commedia Improvviso!</color> grants the following effects for {0}s:
- Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Real Fantasy</color> ignores enemies' DEF by {1}.
- When Roccia lands after performing Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Real Fantasy</color> Stage 3, she is launched into mid-air, activating <color=Highlight><te href=850016>Beyond Imagination</te></color>. In this state, <color=Highlight>Basic Attack</color> becomes Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Reality Recreation</color>, dealing DMG equal to {2} of Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Real Fantasy</color> Stage 3 DMG, considered Heavy Attack DMG. Roccia is immune to interruptions while casting Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Reality Recreation</color>.
- When Roccia lands after performing Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Reality Recreation</color>, she is launched into mid-air, activating <color=Highlight><te href=850016>Beyond Imagination</te></color>. Basic Attack <color=Highlight>Reality Recreation</color> is only available in the <color=Highlight><te href=850016>Beyond Imagination</te></color> state.

81001606.Name: Roccia
81001606.BgDescription: A unique outfit Roccia wears when doing improv comedy. Made out of various scraps, this product of love is decorated with odds and ends that Roccia has accumulated.

160601.Desc: {Cus:Ipt,Touch=Tap PC=Press Gamepad=Press} {0} to pull in nearby targets together and send Roccia into mid-air, activating Beyond Imagination.

160602.Desc: When in Beyond Imagination with sufficient Forte Gauge, {Cus:Ipt,Touch=tap PC=press Gamepad=press} {0} to cast Chain Plunging Attack. Can be cast up to 3 times in a row.

DescList: When Roccia's in Beyond Imagination with enough Forte Gauge, she can cast Chain Plunging Attack.
Casting Outro Skill grants the incoming Resonator a Utility that pulls in targets together.
